content.raw:
Are the current executables going to be completely removed? In that case, I would recommend some kind of migration plan. 

* If the same behaviour can be obtained with the gz command, then write a wrapper (same name than the binary) with a deprecation message and run the same using the gz tool would be great. 
* If the behaviour is not replicable, we could have a period (between releases) where the two options exists (gz tool and the previos gzlog, gzsdf, ...) including a deprecation message.
